articles.title: Carbon Tax Controversy Heats Up
articles.summary: Canada's federal carbon tax continues to spark debate among provinces and political leaders.
articles.content:
The federal carbon tax has been a lightning rod in Canadian politics...

Prime Minister Trudeau defends it as an essential climate measure, while premiers in Alberta and Saskatchewan argue it's punishing consumers...
articles.explainLikeCanadian: This affects your gas bills, heating costs, and groceries. It's a core issue in the East-West divide and in the climate vs affordability debate.

related.title: Provinces Rebel Against Ottawa
related.content:
Alberta and Saskatchewan are leading a rebellion against the federal carbon tax...

Critics argue it’s hurting small businesses and families during an inflation crisis.
related.explainLikeCanadian: Western provinces often feel Ottawa imposes policy that doesn’t reflect regional economies. This highlights ongoing federal-provincial tension.

related.title: Canada’s Climate Policy in Global Context
related.content:
Canada is one of the only G7 countries to have introduced a national carbon tax...

But its effectiveness is debated, especially as global carbon emissions continue to rise.
related.explainLikeCanadian: This looks at Canada’s efforts to align with international climate goals, while balancing domestic economic needs.
